data.question: What is the chemical formula of the nickel bis(dithiolene-dibenzoic acid) ligand designed for the MOF?
What is the maximum Faradaic efficiency (FE) for HCOO– production achieved by MOF 1 at -1.3 V vs RHE?
Does MOF 1 demonstrate better electrocatalytic performance for CO2 reduction to HCOO– compared to MOF 2?
What is the role of [NiS4] sites in MOF 1 for CO2 electroreduction?
data.answer: They serve as CO2 binding sites and efficient catalytic centers.

data.question: What is the crystal system of MOF 1?
Is the electrical conductivity of MOF 1 higher than that of MOF 2?
What method was used for the density functional theory (DFT) calculations?
What is the BET surface area of MOF 1?
Can MOF 1 maintain its structural integrity after electrocatalysis?
What is the main liquid product of CO2 reduction by MOF 1?
What is the role of the [NiS4] sites in enhancing the electrocatalytic performance of MOF 1?
data.answer: They mimic the active sites of formate dehydrogenase and CO-dehydrogenase, leading to selective production of formate.

data.question: Does the MOF 1 structure contain interpenetrated frameworks?
What is the charge-transfer resistance (Rct) of MOF 1 compared to MOF 2?
data.answer: The Rct of MOF 1 (46.88 Ω) is significantly lower than that of MOF 2 (81.84 Ω).

data.question: What is the synthesis temperature for MOF 1?
Is the electrochemical surface area (ECSA) of MOF 1 larger than that of MOF 2?
What is the main advantage of incorporating nickel bis(dithiolene) ligands into MOF 1?
data.answer: It enhances the electrical conductivity and provides unsaturated metal sites for catalysis.

data.question: Does MOF 1 exhibit long-term stability over 12 hours of continuous electrocatalysis?
What is the solvent used in the synthesis of MOF 1?
What is the role of dimethylammonium cation (Me2NH2+) in MOF 1?
data.answer: It exists in the cavity to balance the charge.

data.question: Is the performance of MOF 1 in electrocatalytic CO2 reduction superior to most other MOF catalysts?
